snippet: The Obama administration stepped up pressure on the Internal Revenue Service and sought to insulate itself from the outcry over the agency’s special scrutiny of conservative groups.
abstract: Pres Obama announces that Internal Revenue Service acting commissioner Steven Miller has been ousted after disclosures that agency gave special scrutiny to conservative groups; president acted as his administration steps up pressure on IRS and seeks to insulate itself from outcry over agency's conduct.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration stepped up pressure on the Internal Revenue Service and sought to insulate itself from the outcry over the agency’s special scrutiny of conservative groups.

headline.seo: Acting Chief of I.R.S. Forced Out Over Targeting of Tea Party
headline.main: I.R.S. Chief Out After Protest Over Scrutiny of Groups
headline.print_headline: After Outcry, Chief of I.R.S. Is Forced Out
